questions.question: What does 'supervised learning' involve?
questions.correct_answer: Training a model on labeled data
incorrect_answers: Training a model on unlabeled data
Training a model on partially labeled data

questions.question: Which of the following is a common language used for AI programming?
What is the main purpose of exploratory data analysis (EDA)?
questions.correct_answer: To understand the main characteristics of the data
incorrect_answers: To create a machine learning model

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for classification problems?
Which of the following is an example of unsupervised learning?
What is a data frame in Python?
questions.correct_answer: A two-dimensional, size-mutable data structure in pandas
incorrect_answers: A file format for data storage
A type of array in NumPy

questions.question: Which of the following is a hyperparameter in machine learning?

What is a confusion matrix used for?

Which of these AI systems uses layers to simulate the human brain?
Which Python library is commonly used for data visualization?

incorrect_answers: To improve the accuracy of the model
To reduce the size of the dataset

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a generative adversarial network (GAN)?
questions.correct_answer: It uses two neural networks in competition to generate new data
incorrect_answers: It is used for regression problems
It is a type of unsupervised learning algorithm
It only uses a single neural network for predictions

questions.question: What is the role of the 'p-value' in statistical hypothesis testing?
questions.correct_answer: It indicates the strength of evidence against the null hypothesis
incorrect_answers: It measures the accuracy of a model
It is used to normalize data
It represents the error rate in predictions

questions.correct_answer: L1 results in sparse solutions, while L2 shrinks coefficients but doesnâ€™t set them to zero
incorrect_answers: L2 results in sparse solutions, while L1 shrinks coefficients
L1 is used for classification, L2 for regression

questions.question: Which metric is best suited for imbalanced classification problems?
Which of the following describes reinforcement learning?
questions.correct_answer: The model learns by interacting with an environment and receiving rewards or penalties
incorrect_answers: The model learns from labeled data
The model is trained on structured data
The model is built using decision trees
